meanings.definition: To call by a wrong name or title.
meanings.sent1: She miscalled her friend's name during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher miscalled the student's name on the attendance sheet.
meanings.sent3: He miscalled his dog 'Fluffy' when its name was actually 'Buddy'.
meanings.sent4: The announcer miscalled the winner of the race, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mistake in miscalling the suspect almost led to a wrongful arrest.

meanings.sent1: The weather forecaster miscalled the storm's arrival time.
meanings.sent2: The referee miscalled the final play, leading to a controversial ending.
meanings.sent3: The magician miscalled the card trick, surprising everyone with a different outcome.
meanings.sent4: The historian miscalled the date of the battle, causing a discrepancy in the records.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller's prediction was miscalled, as the opposite happened instead.
